snippet: CALIFORNIA unfurled its latest attack on cigarette smoking last month, a high-profile, $22 million campaign that takes on new urgency in light of a recently released study showing that smoking among California adults rose last year for the first t...
lead_paragraph: CALIFORNIA unfurled its latest attack on cigarette smoking last month, a high-profile, $22 million campaign that takes on new urgency in light of a recently released study showing that smoking among California adults rose last year for the first time in eight years. The study by the state's Department of Health Services found that 18.6 percent of adults smoked, compared with 25 percent of the population nationwide, and also said that smoking was likely to accelerate among teen-agers, the audience opponents of smoking say is most vulnerable to pro-tobacco messages.
abstract: California unfurled its lastest attack on cigarette smoking last month, high-profile $22 million campaign that takes on new urgency in light of recently released study by state's Department of Health Services showing that smoking among California adults rose last year for first time in eight years; Asher/Gould Advertising created 16 radio and television ads; other ads will be developed by Valdes Zacky Associates, Imada Wong Communications and Carol H Williams Advertising; photo (L)

headline.main: California takes on the tobacco industry with a $22 million campaign to discourage smoking.
